commands.notes: Show recent field observations and measurements
commands.lore: Display evolutionary timeline and key discoveries
commands.socials: Show project social media and communication channels
commands.clear: Clear terminal display for new session

notes.observation: Specimen UV-7742: Wing membrane traces detected under ultraviolet light. Preservation exceptional.
Comparative analysis with Solnhofen specimens shows 15% larger wingspan. Flight capability significantly enhanced.
Isotope ratios indicate marine-influenced diet. Coastal environment confirmed through sediment analysis.
Microscopic examination reveals bacteria-mediated fossilization process. Soft tissue details preserved at cellular level.
Digital tomography reveals previously unknown pneumatic bone structure. Weight reduction approximately 12%.
Feather barbule microstructure analyzed. Asymmetrical design confirms powered flight rather than gliding only.
Gastroliths discovered in abdominal cavity. Diet included hard seeds and possibly small crustaceans.
Pectoral girdle morphology shows fusion patterns unique to specimen. Possible sexual dimorphism marker.
Trace element analysis suggests seasonal migration behavior. Strontium signatures indicate 200km range.
Neural canal casting reveals enlarged optic lobes. Visual acuity estimated 3x modern raptorial birds.
Biomechanical modeling complete. Take-off velocity calculated at 4.2 m/s from ground level.
Coprolite analysis from surrounding matrix shows dietary overlap with contemporary species.

research_status.next_phase: Field testing of flight mechanics hypotheses
